message: My initials happen to be the web address of a pretty big retailer.  I also happened to be an early adopter of Twitter, but don't find it all that useful. Realizing that I can't outright sell them my twitter name, any suggestions on how to approach them to have them compensate me for the use/adoption of my account?
You can't.  You have to sit tight in hopes they'll contact you.
@ae its not rare to sell verified accounts. Although being its a major company they might find this against their ethics.

Selling is a negotiation. If you are serious about wanting to sell, then you need to find out who on the other side can make a decision to buy. You will never know if they don't care, just are not aware, or just put off by the idea unless you make a connection. There is a caveat: Twitter terms of use state "Attempts to sell, buy, or solicit other forms of payment in exchange for usernames are also violations and may result in permanent account suspension.http://support.twitter.com/groups/33-report-a-violation/topics/148-policy-information/articles/18370-name-squatting-policy
Then again there is Tweexchange "The Ultimate Twitter Name Marketplace" , http://techcrunch.com/2009/05/01/tweexchange-is-the-ultimate-twitter-name-marketplace/
